org.fun.game.tetris

Class Tetromino

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fun.game.tetris.Tetromino

  • public class Tetromino
extends java.lang.Object
    A Tetromino for the Tetris game.

    Tetrominoes, occasionally known alternately as Tetrads, Blocks, or Tetriminoes, are the blocks used in every known Tetris game. They come in seven shapes, all of which can be rotated and then dropped.

    A tetromino, is a polyomino made of four square blocks. The seven one-sided tetrominoes are:

    • Tetromino.Shape.I: I-shape or Line-shape;
    • Tetromino.Shape.J: J-shape or MirroredL-shape;
    • Tetromino.Shape.L: L-shape;
    • Tetromino.Shape.O: O-shape or Square-shape;
    • Tetromino.Shape.S: S-shape;
    • Tetromino.Shape.T: T-shape;
    • Tetromino.Shape.Z: Z-shape.

    This class is based on Jan Bodnar's Tetris game clone in Java Swing.

    Author:
    Jan Bodnar, Mathieu Brunot
    See Also:
    Tetromino, TGM legend, Tetris game clone in Java Swing

    • Method Detail

      • setShape

        public final void setShape(Tetromino.Shape shape)
        Set the Tetromino's shape.

        The Tetromino's blocks coordinates are set according the shape's default coordinates.

        Parameters:
        shape - the new Tetromino's shape. If null, then all blocks are set to origin.
        See Also:
        blocks, pieceShape, Tetromino.Shape.getDefaultCoords()
